intro: Draba sphaeroides, commonly known as the globe whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers make it a distinctive feature in its habitat. Draba sphaeroides is often found in alpine meadows and tundra, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
